headline: After Flurry of Cabinet Picks, Trump Rethinks Candidates for Treasury Secretary
abstract: President-elect Donald J. Trump is expected to invite the contenders for the role, including Kevin Warsh and Marc Rowan, to Mar-a-Lago this week.
lead_paragraph: President-elect Donald J. Trump is eyeing a new candidate for Treasury Secretary amid internal debate over who should have the role: the former Federal Reserve governor Kevin Warsh.
snippet: President-elect Donald J. Trump is expected to invite the contenders for the role, including Kevin Warsh and Marc Rowan, to Mar-a-Lago this week.

headline: What Are ATACMS, the U.S. Missiles That Officials Say Ukraine Fired Into Russia?
abstract: In a major policy shift, the Biden administration has authorized Ukraine to use the ballistic missiles within Russia.
lead_paragraph: Ukraine’s military used American-made ATACMS missiles to strike into Russia for the first time on Tuesday, according to senior U.S. and Ukrainian officials.
snippet: In a major policy shift, the Biden administration has authorized Ukraine to use the ballistic missiles within Russia.

headline: The Truly Incredible Story of Keiko the Killer Whale
abstract: One whale, and what it represents for millions of people.
lead_paragraph: On This Week’s Episode:
snippet: One whale, and what it represents for millions of people.

headline: Review: In ‘Elf’ on Broadway, Buddy Lands on the Very, Very Nice List
abstract: The musical, starring Grey Henson, has gotten Buddy delightfully, entirely right. But he is trapped inside a creaky adaptation.
lead_paragraph: Santa Clauses are pretty interchangeable. The real Santa’s close friend Buddy the elf would disagree, but it’s true: Put on the red costume, hide behind the glossy beard, manage a few ho, ho, hos and anyone will do.
snippet: The musical, starring Grey Henson, has gotten Buddy delightfully, entirely right. But he is trapped inside a creaky adaptation.

headline: Trump Picks Brendan Carr to Lead F.C.C.
abstract: Mr. Carr, who currently sits on the commission and is a vocal critic of Big Tech, has said the agency should regulate the tech industry.
lead_paragraph: President-elect Donald J. Trump on Sunday chose Brendan Carr to be chairman of the Federal Communications Commission, naming a veteran Republican regulator who has publicly agreed with the incoming administration’s promises to slash regulation, go after Big Tech and punish TV networks for political bias.
snippet: Mr. Carr, who currently sits on the commission and is a vocal critic of Big Tech, has said the agency should regulate the tech industry.

headline: Shouting Racial Slurs, Neo-Nazi Marchers Shock Ohio’s Capital
abstract: The demonstration in Columbus on Saturday, part of a recent pattern of white supremacist incidents in the country, was condemned by officials around the state.
lead_paragraph: Officials in Columbus, Ohio, and across the nation condemned a small group of people who marched through a part of the city on Saturday carrying Nazi flags and shouting racial slurs and expressions of white power.
snippet: The demonstration in Columbus on Saturday, part of a recent pattern of white supremacist incidents in the country, was condemned by officials around the state.

headline: Oregon School Leaders on Leave After 2 Teachers Are Charged With Sex Abuse
abstract: The police said the St. Helens School District was informed of the abuse allegations as early as 2019 but officials failed to alert the authorities.
lead_paragraph: Two Oregon high school teachers charged on Tuesday with sexually abusing students had been reported as early as 2019 to district officials, who failed to notify the authorities, according to the police.
snippet: The police said the St. Helens School District was informed of the abuse allegations as early as 2019 but officials failed to alert the authorities.

headline: No Corrections: Nov. 18, 2024
abstract: No corrections appeared in print on Monday, Nov. 18, 2024.
lead_paragraph: No corrections appeared in print on Monday, November 18, 2024.
snippet: No corrections appeared in print on Monday, Nov. 18, 2024.

headline: ‘Dune: Prophecy’ Season 1 Premiere Recap: Sick Burn
abstract: The first installment of HBO’s “Dune” prequel series suggests there is a “burning truth” very few are capable of seeing. It may be too hot to handle.
lead_paragraph: “Humanity’s greatest weapon is the lie,” says Reverend Mother Tula Harkonnen of the Sisterhood (Olivia Williams). “Human beings rely on lies to survive. We lie to our enemies, we lie to our friends, we lie to ourselves. Lying is among the most sophisticated tasks a brain can perform.”
snippet: The first installment of HBO’s “Dune” prequel series suggests there is a “burning truth” very few are capable of seeing. It may be too hot to handle.

headline: Quote of the Day: How Harris’s Campaign Spent $1.5 Billion in Just 15 Weeks
abstract: Quotation of the Day for Monday, November 18, 2024.
lead_paragraph: “We had so much money it was hard to get it out the door.”
snippet: Quotation of the Day for Monday, November 18, 2024.

headline: On Migration, Europe Warms to Ideas Once Seen as Fringe
abstract: As in the United States, a decline in the numbers of migrants crossing borders has not stopped anti-migrant sentiments from gaining ground.
lead_paragraph: Europe has been struggling for years to limit the number of unauthorized migrants entering by land and sea, instituting increasingly tough policies. Those moves now appear to be working, with the numbers of migrants crossing into European Union countries decreasing dramatically from highs last year.
snippet: As in the United States, a decline in the numbers of migrants crossing borders has not stopped anti-migrant sentiments from gaining ground.

headline: Monday Briefing
abstract: A major change in U.S. policy on Ukraine.
lead_paragraph: President Biden will allow Ukraine for the first time to use U.S.-supplied long-range missiles to strike deeper inside Russia, U.S. officials said.
snippet: A major change in U.S. policy on Ukraine.

headline: We’re About to Find Out How Much America’s Leadership Matters
abstract: Donald Trump’s re-election to the American presidency is a threat to global peace and security.
lead_paragraph: The global legal order rests on a kind of collective act of faith. For it to work, nations must trust that other nations will behave as if its principles matter. The system is not so unlike the dollar in this respect: It holds value only when — and only because — most of those who use it believe that it does.
snippet: Donald Trump’s re-election to the American presidency is a threat to global peace and security.

headline: ‘The Sex Lives of College Girls,’ Plus 7 Things to Watch on TV this Week
abstract: Catch up with the group from Essex College, go behind the scenes of Ridley Scott’s new movie and get your Bravo fill.
lead_paragraph: Before Reneé Rapp toured sold-out shows or performed songs from her new album on “Saturday Night Live,” she played Leighton Murray, a mean-girl-turned-softy in “The Sex Lives of College Girls.” The show is returning this week for its third season, but Rapp will be absent from most of it — she renegotiated her contract from a series regular to a guest star. It will continue to follow the roommates Kimberly (Pauline Chalamet), Bela (Amrit Kaur) and Whitney (Alyah Chanelle Scott), who left things on rocky footing at the end of the last season. Available to stream at 9 p.m. on Thursday on Max.
snippet: Catch up with the group from Essex College, go behind the scenes of Ridley Scott’s new movie and get your Bravo fill.

headline: Word of the Day: gesticulate
abstract: This word has appeared in eight articles on NYTimes.com in the past year. Can you use it in a sentence?
lead_paragraph: The word gesticulate has appeared in eight articles on NYTimes.com in the past year, including on Sept. 30 in “A Veteran Falstaff Looks Back, and Ahead” by Rebecca Schmid. The article includes an interview with Ambrogio Maestri, who has sung the title role in Verdi’s comedy hundreds of times, most recently for the Paris Opera. He’s also making room for a Puccini tragedy. Mr. Maestri states:
snippet: This word has appeared in eight articles on NYTimes.com in the past year. Can you use it in a sentence?

headline: Emergency Declared as Smog Chokes Parts of India and Pakistan
abstract: The authorities in New Delhi closed schools and urged residents to stay home. Similar measures have been implemented in Punjab, Pakistan’s largest province.
lead_paragraph: The authorities in New Delhi closed schools and urged people to stay indoors as toxic smog, which has plagued neighboring Pakistan for weeks, choked India’s capital in what officials called a medical emergency.
snippet: The authorities in New Delhi closed schools and urged residents to stay home. Similar measures have been implemented in Punjab, Pakistan’s largest province.

headline: Alan Jones, Former Australian Shock Jock, Charged With Sexual Abuse
abstract: The retired radio host, who was granted bail after being arrested, was accused of abusing eight victims over nearly 20 years.
lead_paragraph: Alan Jones, a retired controversial Australian talk radio host, was arrested on Monday in Sydney and charged with nearly two dozen counts of sexual abuse.
snippet: The retired radio host, who was granted bail after being arrested, was accused of abusing eight victims over nearly 20 years.

headline: She Moved to New Delhi for a Fresh Start, but the Air Made Her Sick
abstract: Since moving to New Delhi, which had the world’s worst air quality on Monday, Ameesha Munjal hasn’t been able to exercise or see friends. She has been on several medications to battle sickness caused by the pollution.
lead_paragraph: Since moving to New Delhi, which had the world’s worst air quality on Monday, Ameesha Munjal hasn’t been able to exercise or see friends. She has been on several medications to battle sickness caused by the pollution.
snippet: Since moving to New Delhi, which had the world’s worst air quality on Monday, Ameesha Munjal hasn’t been able to exercise or see friends. She has been on several medications to battle sickness caused by the pollution.

headline: Will a ‘Trump Bump’ Help the Art Market’s Biggest Week?
abstract: After the U.S. election, auctioneers are looking to woo reluctant bidders back. Watch these 6 bellwether artworks to see how the market performs.
lead_paragraph: Will the art market go bananas again, like it did before the pandemic, now that Donald J. Trump has been elected to the White House on promises to cut taxes? Speculative investments like cryptocurrencies have risen in anticipation of a new Republican administration’s anti-regulatory agenda, and the auction world hopes that it can ride an economic boom to recovery after nearly two years of declining sales.
snippet: After the U.S. election, auctioneers are looking to woo reluctant bidders back. Watch these 6 bellwether artworks to see how the market performs.

headline: Spelling Bee Forum
abstract: Feeling stuck on today’s puzzle? We can help.
lead_paragraph: Hi busy bees! Welcome to today’s Spelling Bee forum. There are a number of terms that appear in both this article and other online discussions of the Spelling Bee; a glossary of those terms compiled by Monicat, a Times reader, can be found below.
snippet: Feeling stuck on today’s puzzle? We can help.

headline: Substack Bets on Politics, With Millions at Stake
abstract: The newsletter start-up, which once drew an overture from Elon Musk, is betting on politics content and recruiting stars. But profits remain elusive.
lead_paragraph: In April 2023, the newsletter platform Substack received an unexpected proposal from Elon Musk, who had recently purchased Twitter.
snippet: The newsletter start-up, which once drew an overture from Elon Musk, is betting on politics content and recruiting stars. But profits remain elusive.

headline: Will a $9 Congestion-Pricing Toll Yield Enough Money to Fix the Subway?
abstract: Slashing the original $15 toll raises questions about whether a smaller revenue stream could delay projects or lead to higher costs for New York’s public transit agency.
lead_paragraph: As congestion pricing makes a comeback, there is a lot at stake for New York City’s aging mass transit system.
snippet: Slashing the original $15 toll raises questions about whether a smaller revenue stream could delay projects or lead to higher costs for New York’s public transit agency.

headline: For Decades, Installing E.V. Chargers Didn’t Pay Off for Retailers. Now It Does.
abstract: Companies see charging as a potentially profitable business in and of itself, not just as a spur for foot traffic and sales.
lead_paragraph: Sarajane Leary knows what to do when her electric car is low on power: She goes grocery shopping.
snippet: Companies see charging as a potentially profitable business in and of itself, not just as a spur for foot traffic and sales.

headline: José Andrés Hopes to Transform Dining. This Time, at the Airport.
abstract: The Michelin-starred chef and humanitarian has partnered with Capital One to open a lounge-restaurant hybrid at Ronald Reagan Washington National Airport.
lead_paragraph: Yes, it will offer grab-n-go purchases, specialty cocktails, and plenty of alcoves for suitcases and charging outlets. It is backed by a credit-card issuer, with a world-famous chef attached.
snippet: The Michelin-starred chef and humanitarian has partnered with Capital One to open a lounge-restaurant hybrid at Ronald Reagan Washington National Airport.

headline: Tales of 19th-Century A.I.: Don’t Fall in Love With a Singing Robot
abstract: Now we fret about chatbots. An earlier age worried about automatons, the uncanny humanoid contraptions whose voices could trigger love or mania.
lead_paragraph: Love me, love me, pretend that you love me.
snippet: Now we fret about chatbots. An earlier age worried about automatons, the uncanny humanoid contraptions whose voices could trigger love or mania.

headline: 7 Days in the Cultural Life of a Broadway Stage Manager
abstract: When he’s not herding performers at “Once Upon a Mattress,” Cody Renard Richard is bowling, catching up with theater friends and, to his surprise, bumping into Beyoncé.
lead_paragraph: Cody Renard Richard is backstage at the Hudson Theater eight performances a week, wrangling actors and calling cues at “Once Upon a Mattress.”
snippet: When he’s not herding performers at “Once Upon a Mattress,” Cody Renard Richard is bowling, catching up with theater friends and, to his surprise, bumping into Beyoncé.

headline: How Healthy Are Sweet Potatoes?
abstract: Their moment in the spotlight has arrived. Let’s take a look at their best qualities.
lead_paragraph: The marshmallows notwithstanding, sweet potatoes are one of the healthiest foods on your Thanksgiving table. They’re full of nutrients that keep your systems humming and your blood sugar steady, and they can even reduce your cancer risk.
snippet: Their moment in the spotlight has arrived. Let’s take a look at their best qualities.

headline: Haruki Murakami’s New Novel Doesn’t Feel All That New
abstract: “The City and Its Uncertain Walls” features all the author’s signature elements — and his singular voice — in a story he has told before.
lead_paragraph: When we first meet the nameless narrator of Haruki Murakami’s eerie new novel, “The City and Its Uncertain Walls,” he is a high school loner whose only friend is his cat. A chance meeting at a school awards ceremony brings him into the orbit of an equally isolated eccentric 16-year-old who can’t always distinguish her dreams from real life.
snippet: “The City and Its Uncertain Walls” features all the author’s signature elements — and his singular voice — in a story he has told before.

headline: New to New York, and Dazzled by the Energy of Times Square
abstract: A couple who finally live full-time in the city sometimes can’t believe they have their own home in the middle of the craziness.
lead_paragraph: When Candice Gwak and David Xie moved from Southern California to New York City, they settled in Hell’s Kitchen, just a block from the chaos and crowds of Times Square, the very place many New Yorkers love to hate.
snippet: A couple who finally live full-time in the city sometimes can’t believe they have their own home in the middle of the craziness.

headline: Avengers, Assemble
abstract: All eyes on Trump and his cabinet picks.
lead_paragraph: Gail Collins: OK, Bret. Who’s your pick for the worst Trump nomination? I know there’s a lot to choose from — but I’ve got dibs on Matt Gaetz.
snippet: All eyes on Trump and his cabinet picks.

headline: The ‘Death Becomes Her’ Frenemies Take Their Youth Potion to Broadway
abstract: The campy supernatural movie comes to Broadway as a big, bawdy musical starring Megan Hilty and Jennifer Simard.
lead_paragraph: To be a marquee name after the ingénue years and to feel validated in a cutthroat business: For many actresses on Broadway or anywhere, those can be constant cravings. For Megan Hilty, one of the stars of the new Broadway musical “Death Becomes Her,” they’re urgent themes.
snippet: The campy supernatural movie comes to Broadway as a big, bawdy musical starring Megan Hilty and Jennifer Simard.

headline: How a Gen X Graphic Novelist Reinvented the Romance Comic
abstract: To fully understand Charles Burns’s remarkable graphic novel, “Final Cut,” you have to look closely at the way in which it was rendered.
lead_paragraph: To fully understand Charles Burns’s remarkable graphic novel, “Final Cut,” you have to look closely at the way in which it was rendered.
snippet: To fully understand Charles Burns’s remarkable graphic novel, “Final Cut,” you have to look closely at the way in which it was rendered.

headline: The New Anti-Abortion Argument Takes Us Back to the 19th Century
abstract: Three states are calling on the federal courts for help in making women have more babies.
lead_paragraph: Although I’ve heard every argument about abortion, pro and con, over the years, the anti-abortion case made by three Republican-led states in a recent Federal District Court filing stopped me in my tracks.
snippet: Three states are calling on the federal courts for help in making women have more babies.

headline: Millennial Pregnancy Gets Its Demi Moore Moment
abstract: Decades after Moore appeared pregnant and naked on the cover of Vanity Fair, the pregnant body is thoroughly eroticized and commodified — but still provocative.
lead_paragraph: Molly Baz is among the millennial generation’s most influential cooks, and after she became pregnant, she expanded her reach to the care and feeding of parents and babies. In May, she starred in an ad campaign for the breastfeeding startup Swehl, serving up a new recipe for lactation cookies. In one shot, she wore underwear and a rhinestone bikini, presenting an exposed belly and a pair of oatmeal cookies centered with drops of cherry jam, which she held atop her chest as a goofy visual joke. The ad copy said: “Just Add Milk.”
snippet: Decades after Moore appeared pregnant and naked on the cover of Vanity Fair, the pregnant body is thoroughly eroticized and commodified — but still provocative.

headline: Is This the End of the White Working-Class Democrat?
abstract: Democrats hoped to lose by less in blue-collar areas that had drifted toward Donald Trump. In many places, they may have lost by more.
lead_paragraph: In Ohio, Senator Sherrod Brown, a longtime champion of working-class voters, was toppled by a rich Republican former car dealer.
snippet: Democrats hoped to lose by less in blue-collar areas that had drifted toward Donald Trump. In many places, they may have lost by more.

headline: Revisiting Pina Bausch’s World of Love and Longing in Aging Bodies
abstract: “Kontakthof,” a pivotal Bausch dance from 1978, is being staged with members of the original cast. They talk about coming back to it nearly 50 years later.
lead_paragraph: Toward the end of Pina Bausch’s “Kontakthof,” a woman stands alone onstage, eyes cast down, disconsolate. One by one, men approach, gently caressing her shoulders, tweaking her nose, stroking her hair, rubbing her legs and stomach. Slowly, the relentless accumulation of these gestures transforms them from affection to assault; tenderness has mutated into aggression, pity into victimization.
snippet: “Kontakthof,” a pivotal Bausch dance from 1978, is being staged with members of the original cast. They talk about coming back to it nearly 50 years later.

headline: Why Oil Companies Are Walking Back From Green Energy
abstract: As leaders gather for a global climate summit, investors are rewarding oil giants like Exxon Mobil that did not embrace wind and solar.
lead_paragraph: When oil and gas companies made ambitious commitments four years ago to curb emissions and transition to renewable energy, their businesses were in free fall.
snippet: As leaders gather for a global climate summit, investors are rewarding oil giants like Exxon Mobil that did not embrace wind and solar.

headline: How Can I Green Up My Investments?
abstract: It’s not that hard, and there’s a bonus: Portfolios without fossil fuels have generally performed just as well as the broader market.
lead_paragraph: With the world on track for its hottest year in modern history, maybe you’ve decided to invest your money in a way that’s better for the planet.
snippet: It’s not that hard, and there’s a bonus: Portfolios without fossil fuels have generally performed just as well as the broader market.

headline: What’s Right and Wrong About Trump’s Defense Secretary Pick
abstract: Pete Hegseth may not be qualified, but his nomination at least represents a legitimate policy change after over 20 years of failed wars.
lead_paragraph: Pete Hegseth, like many of President-elect Donald Trump’s cabinet picks so far, may seem unworthy of the role he has been tapped to fill. But the instinct to choose someone like him is not.
snippet: Pete Hegseth may not be qualified, but his nomination at least represents a legitimate policy change after over 20 years of failed wars.

headline: Venezuela’s ‘Iron Lady’ Pleads With Trump to Save Her Country’s Democracy
abstract: In a series of rare in-depth interviews, Venezuela’s opposition leader called life in hiding “a difficult test” and asserted that Mr. Trump could gain an early “foreign policy victory” by pushing Nicolás Maduro from office.
lead_paragraph: She galvanized a nation to oust Venezuela’s autocrat at the ballot box, spending months surrounded by people and filling avenues with supporters who risked beatings and arrest just to hear her speak.
snippet: In a series of rare in-depth interviews, Venezuela’s opposition leader called life in hiding “a difficult test” and asserted that Mr. Trump could gain an early “foreign policy victory” by pushing Nicolás Maduro from office.

headline: $2.4 Million Homes in California
abstract: A hillside compound in Topanga Canyon, a remodeled four-bedroom house in Pacifica, and a three-bedroom bungalow in Sausalito.
lead_paragraph: This property set on 0.44 acres in Topanga Canyon comprises two houses: the main four-bedroom, three-bath house, and a separate one-bedroom, one-bath guesthouse with a living room and kitchen. Trails for hiking and horseback riding link the property to Topanga State Park. A stretch of Topanga Canyon Boulevard with a general store, a pizza shop and a post office is five minutes away, as is Inn of the Seventh Ray, a popular event venue and restaurant specializing in organic food.
snippet: A hillside compound in Topanga Canyon, a remodeled four-bedroom house in Pacifica, and a three-bedroom bungalow in Sausalito.

headline: No, Trump Cannot Run for Re-election Again in 2028
abstract: The Constitution sets a two-term limit for presidents. Still, Donald J. Trump has repeatedly floated the idea that he might like to stay in the White House beyond his next term.
lead_paragraph: President-elect Donald J. Trump has mused more than once that he might like to extend his next stay at the White House. But can he run for re-election again in 2028 and seek a third term? The simple answer: No, the Constitution does not allow it.
snippet: The Constitution sets a two-term limit for presidents. Still, Donald J. Trump has repeatedly floated the idea that he might like to stay in the White House beyond his next term.

headline: We Can’t Keep Waiting for Our Leaders to Save Us
abstract: We have hardly begun to understand how inextricably our own health and safety are intertwined with those of our wild neighbors.
lead_paragraph: We were living in a cataclysmic age of mass extinction and climate instability even before the election. Now the climate denier in chief is poised to gut the environmental protections that do exist. Even so, conservation nonprofits are struggling to raise the funds they need to challenge his wrecking-ball agenda in court. The people who care are feeling defeated, and the fight has not yet begun.
snippet: We have hardly begun to understand how inextricably our own health and safety are intertwined with those of our wild neighbors.

headline: Ladies and Gentlemen, the Northeast Is Burning
abstract: We are being reminded the hard way that we share this world. Smoke knows no boundaries, and neither does fire.
lead_paragraph: The smoke around New York City is back. But don’t blame Canada.
snippet: We are being reminded the hard way that we share this world. Smoke knows no boundaries, and neither does fire.

headline: Hungary Shows Us How a Second Trump Term Might Play Out
abstract: Autocrats have a playbook.
lead_paragraph: Donald Trump has referred to Hungary’s autocratic prime minister, Viktor Orban, as “a great man, a great leader.” In this episode of “The Opinions,” the columnist M. Gessen, who is in exile from Vladimir Putin’s Russia, draws parallels between Trump, Orban and Putin. Gessen explores what life might look like in Trump’s next term and describes their fear that, this time, “people are going to retreat into their private lives and try to shut out the political world.”
snippet: Autocrats have a playbook.

headline: How Do I Decide What Socks to Wear?
abstract: A reader seeks advice on choosing the right socks for an outfit. Our fashion critic suggests a different approach altogether to styling the essential accessory.
lead_paragraph: As far as I am concerned, socks are the underappreciated star of the accessories universe. Handbags get most of the attention, ties and watches a bit, but socks, despite the fact that they are an essential part of everyone’s wardrobe, are often treated as an afterthought, the footwear equivalent of the undershirt.
snippet: A reader seeks advice on choosing the right socks for an outfit. Our fashion critic suggests a different approach altogether to styling the essential accessory.

headline: The Fight to Save a Decrepit Pink House by the Sea
abstract: The 99-year-old house on Boston’s North Shore is battered and uninhabited. And yet, it is beloved by artists and locals — so much that they helped pause its demolition.
lead_paragraph: There is no shortage of beautiful houses along the coastline north of Boston: houses with graceful white columns and gleaming granite stairs. Houses with sparkling bay windows and manicured gardens.
snippet: The 99-year-old house on Boston’s North Shore is battered and uninhabited. And yet, it is beloved by artists and locals — so much that they helped pause its demolition.

headline: A Miniature New York Made of Bark and Acorns
abstract: At the New York Botanical Garden’s model train show, the city’s famous buildings cluster around the tracks.
lead_paragraph: Good morning. It’s Monday. We’ll tour a city within the city, built with acorns and tree bark and other plants. We’ll also get details on the State Department of Labor’s inquiry into Shen Yun Performing Arts.
snippet: At the New York Botanical Garden’s model train show, the city’s famous buildings cluster around the tracks.

headline: Jake Paul vs. Mike Tyson Is the Absurd Spectacle We Deserve
abstract: The exhibition fight was always meant to be an empty spectacle. But in an attention economy, substance will never compete with overhyped emptiness.
lead_paragraph: Half the fun of any fight, whether it’s boxing, wrestling or mixed martial arts, is the prefight hype. The opponents call each other terrible names, they glare in each other’s faces at the weigh-in and they appear in a slickly edited video on the Jumbotron as heavy metal music blares — all of it conspiring to persuade everyone involved that this Fight of the Century is going to be even better than the one that took place last month.
snippet: The exhibition fight was always meant to be an empty spectacle. But in an attention economy, substance will never compete with overhyped emptiness.

headline: As Trump Looms, Biden Makes a Twilight Pitch on Ukraine to Global Leaders
abstract: The president approved Ukraine’s use of long-range missiles inside Russia, but that decision, among others, may soon be reversed.
lead_paragraph: President Biden began what is likely to be his last summit with global leaders as commander in chief on Monday, pushing for even stronger support of Ukraine despite the looming uncertainty of how President-elect Donald J. Trump might undo his efforts.
snippet: The president approved Ukraine’s use of long-range missiles inside Russia, but that decision, among others, may soon be reversed.

headline: Spirit Airlines Files for Bankruptcy; Lost $2.2 Billion in 5 Years
abstract: The low-fare carrier has struggled to find its footing after its planned merger with JetBlue was blocked by a federal judge.
lead_paragraph: Spirit Airlines, whose approach to selling cheap tickets without amenities earned it fans and detractors, filed for bankruptcy protection on Monday after a string of setbacks, most recently a failure to renegotiate its looming debt.
snippet: The low-fare carrier has struggled to find its footing after its planned merger with JetBlue was blocked by a federal judge.

headline: Coffee, Juice, Shawarma: Tiny Traces of Normal Life in a Ruined Gaza
abstract: Most people in the enclave are struggling just to survive Israel’s assault on Hamas, and experts say famine is imminent. Yet a few pockets of ordinary life have bloomed in defiance of the war.
lead_paragraph: At long last, something to celebrate: People were saying that the Chef Warif restaurant, whose Syrian-style shawarma sandwiches were famous in Gaza City before the war, had reopened. Not in the city itself, which the war had reduced largely to rubble. And not the same quality of meat, which the restaurant’s owner now had to buy frozen and at steep prices from traders importing it to the Gaza Strip.
snippet: Most people in the enclave are struggling just to survive Israel’s assault on Hamas, and experts say famine is imminent. Yet a few pockets of ordinary life have bloomed in defiance of the war.

headline: Ukraine Has a Window to Strike Within Russia, but Trump May Close It
abstract: President Biden has granted permission for Kyiv to carry out long-range strikes, but looming over Ukraine’s newfound latitude is the ascent of President-elect Trump.
lead_paragraph: Ukraine signaled a new sense of urgency on Monday following a decision by the Biden administration to allow long-range strikes inside Russia using American-provided missiles, with Ukrainian politicians suggesting that the first launches would come soon and without warning.
snippet: President Biden has granted permission for Kyiv to carry out long-range strikes, but looming over Ukraine’s newfound latitude is the ascent of President-elect Trump.

headline: The Connections Companion No. 527
abstract: Scroll down for hints and conversation about the puzzle for Tuesday, Nov. 19, 2024.
lead_paragraph: Good morning, dear connectors. Welcome to today’s Connections forum, where you can give and receive puzzle — and emotional — support.
snippet: Scroll down for hints and conversation about the puzzle for Tuesday, Nov. 19, 2024.

headline: 1 in 8 N.Y.C. Public School Students Was Homeless Last Year
abstract: A record 146,000 students did not have permanent housing, state data shows, as the city dealt with an ongoing housing crisis and an influx of migrants.
lead_paragraph: When a fire broke out in Jessica Beltran’s Brooklyn apartment last year, she and her two children moved into a homeless shelter while they figured out their next steps.
snippet: A record 146,000 students did not have permanent housing, state data shows, as the city dealt with an ongoing housing crisis and an influx of migrants.

headline: Biden’s Big Shift on Ukraine, and Neo-Nazi Marchers Shock Ohio
abstract: Plus, the 50-yard field goal phenomenon.
lead_paragraph: On Today’s Episode:
snippet: Plus, the 50-yard field goal phenomenon.

headline: Will Republicans Reject Gaetz?
abstract: The choice of Matt Gaetz shocked Washington and raised questions about whether the Senate would approve him.
lead_paragraph: President-elect Donald J. Trump has picked Representative Matt Gaetz to be his attorney general.
snippet: The choice of Matt Gaetz shocked Washington and raised questions about whether the Senate would approve him.

headline: Israeli Strikes in Beirut’s Center Shatter a Tenuous Sense of Security
abstract: The strikes, the first in weeks inside Lebanon’s capital, forced residents to come to grips with another escalation of fighting between Israel and Hezbollah.
lead_paragraph: The typically congested streets of Beirut were unusually empty on Monday. Schools that had temporarily shuttered earlier this fall when war first escalated were closed again. Many people who had come back to Lebanon’s capital after fleeing to the northern mountains a month ago had headed north once more.
snippet: The strikes, the first in weeks inside Lebanon’s capital, forced residents to come to grips with another escalation of fighting between Israel and Hezbollah.

headline: I Tried to Teach My Son Soccer. Here’s What He Taught Me.
abstract: After decades reporting on soccer, three months helping to coach a team of children under age 7 came as a revelation.
lead_paragraph: A few weeks ago, the soccer team that occupies rather more of my thoughts than is healthy had a problem. Well, strictly speaking, it had several. One was that all of the players, including my son, were under the age of 7, which it turns out is something of a tactical limitation. Another was that I had been roped into being one of the coaches.
snippet: After decades reporting on soccer, three months helping to coach a team of children under age 7 came as a revelation.

headline: Elon Musk’s Political Influence
abstract: We explore Musk’s agenda and ideology.
lead_paragraph: Over the course of the 2024 presidential campaign, Elon Musk went from dark-money donor to high-profile surrogate to unofficial chief of staff. He camped out at Mar-a-Lago after the election with the Trump family and hopped on Donald Trump’s call with Ukraine’s president. He’s even played diplomat, meeting secretly in New York with Iran’s ambassador to the United Nations.
snippet: We explore Musk’s agenda and ideology.

headline: The Race to Lead Trump’s Treasury Dept. Is Becoming a Cliffhanger
abstract: Howard Lutnick? Scott Bessent? Marc Rowan? Kevin Warsh? The president-elect’s list of candidates has grown longer, clouding the future of the department.
lead_paragraph: Few of the unfilled positions in Donald Trump’s cabinet are as important as Treasury secretary. But the question of who will fill the role is only getting cloudier.
snippet: Howard Lutnick? Scott Bessent? Marc Rowan? Kevin Warsh? The president-elect’s list of candidates has grown longer, clouding the future of the department.

headline: Wordle Review No. 1,248
abstract: Scroll down for hints and conversation about the puzzle for Nov. 18, 2024.
lead_paragraph: Welcome to The Wordle Review. Be warned: This page contains spoilers for today’s puzzle. Solve Wordle first, or scroll at your own risk.
snippet: Scroll down for hints and conversation about the puzzle for Nov. 18, 2024.

headline: Wordle Review No. 1,249
abstract: Scroll down for hints and conversation about the puzzle for Nov. 19, 2024.
lead_paragraph: Welcome to The Wordle Review. Be warned: This page contains spoilers for today’s puzzle. Solve Wordle first, or scroll at your own risk.
snippet: Scroll down for hints and conversation about the puzzle for Nov. 19, 2024.

headline: What Do You Hope to Get Out of College?
abstract: College is a big commitment, in terms of time and money. What do you think is the purpose of continuing your education after high school?
lead_paragraph: Isabella Glassman graduated from the University of Pennsylvania in 2023. In her recent guest essay, she writes about the disconnect between what she expected college to be like and what it actually was like:
snippet: College is a big commitment, in terms of time and money. What do you think is the purpose of continuing your education after high school?

headline: Burglars Broke Into Windsor Castle Estate, Home of Prince William, Kate and Family
abstract: The intruders entered a farm building on the castle estate last month and stole an Isuzu pickup and a quad bike, according to the local police.
lead_paragraph: Intruders broke into the grounds of Windsor Castle last month and stole two vehicles, the police confirmed on Monday, a significant security breach at the sprawling royal estate west of London that is the primary residence of Prince William, his wife Catherine, and their three children.
snippet: The intruders entered a farm building on the castle estate last month and stole an Isuzu pickup and a quad bike, according to the local police.

headline: Climate Talks Head Into the Final Stretch With Negotiators Far Apart
abstract: Senior ministers are arriving in an effort to break a deadlock over the summit’s main goal: funding to help lower-income countries hit hard by global warming.
lead_paragraph: More than halfway through the United Nations climate talks in Baku, Azerbaijan, negotiators from nearly 200 countries remain far apart on a number of the key issues up for debate.
snippet: Senior ministers are arriving in an effort to break a deadlock over the summit’s main goal: funding to help lower-income countries hit hard by global warming.

headline: 22 Thanksgiving Dishes Our Recipe Testers Loved This Year
abstract: Pickle biscuits, sour cream pound cake, esquites stuffing and more new recipes we think you’ll adore, too.
lead_paragraph: At New York Times Cooking, we rely on professional recipe testers to ensure each and every new recipe is clear, works and tastes great. They test about a thousand recipes a year, which is a lot of cooking and eating, so when they really love something, it’s worth taking note. These are a few of the new Thanksgiving recipes that a handful of our testers — Kayla Hoang, Janet McCracken, Lisa Nicklin, Tina Ujlaki and Ben Weiner — couldn’t stop raving about.
snippet: Pickle biscuits, sour cream pound cake, esquites stuffing and more new recipes we think you’ll adore, too.

headline: Texas Education Board to Vote on Bible-Infused Lessons in Public Schools
abstract: A new curriculum would focus on Christianity more than other religions. A kindergarten lesson on the Golden Rule, for example, would teach about Jesus and his Sermon on the Mount.
lead_paragraph: Texas education officials are expected to vote this week on whether to approve a new elementary-school curriculum that infuses teachings on the Bible into reading and language arts lessons.
snippet: A new curriculum would focus on Christianity more than other religions. A kindergarten lesson on the Golden Rule, for example, would teach about Jesus and his Sermon on the Mount.

headline: Saudi Arabia Is a ‘Wrecking Ball’ in Global Climate Talks
abstract: Despite endorsing a transition away from fossil fuels last year, Saudi officials have since worked to undermine it in at least five U.N. forums, diplomats said.
lead_paragraph: As United Nations climate talks enter their final week in Azerbaijan and G20 leaders gather in Brazil, diplomats from Saudi Arabia, the world’s top oil exporter, are working to foil any agreement that renews a pledge to transition away from fossil fuels, negotiators said.
snippet: Despite endorsing a transition away from fossil fuels last year, Saudi officials have since worked to undermine it in at least five U.N. forums, diplomats said.

headline: A Mummified Saber-Toothed Kitten Emerges in Siberia
abstract: The Homotherium cub was preserved in Siberian permafrost with its dark fur and flesh intact.
lead_paragraph: In 2020, prospectors seeking mammoth tusks in eastern Siberia found a bundle of fur protruding from the icy bank of the Badyarikha River. The diggers knew they were looking at something rare: the Ice Age mummy of a cat cub.
snippet: The Homotherium cub was preserved in Siberian permafrost with its dark fur and flesh intact.

headline: Looters Strip Aid From About 100 Trucks in Gaza, U.N. Agency Says
abstract: UNRWA, the main U.N. agency aiding Palestinians, said its drivers were forced at gunpoint to unload supplies in what it called one of the worst such incidents of the war.
lead_paragraph: A large convoy of trucks carrying aid was “violently looted” in the Gaza Strip over the weekend and its drivers forced at gunpoint to unload supplies, the main United Nations agency that helps Palestinians said on Monday, calling it one of the worst such incidents of the war.
snippet: UNRWA, the main U.N. agency aiding Palestinians, said its drivers were forced at gunpoint to unload supplies in what it called one of the worst such incidents of the war.

headline: Robert F. Kennedy Jr.’s Views on Vaccination ‘Dangerous,’ Says His Ambassador Cousin
abstract: “Others are just getting to know him,” Caroline Kennedy, the U.S. ambassador to Australia, said of her cousin, President-elect Donald J. Trump’s pick for health secretary.
lead_paragraph: Caroline Kennedy, the U.S. ambassador to Australia, said on Monday that her cousin Robert F. Kennedy Jr.’s ideas about vaccination were “dangerous” and out of the mainstream.
snippet: “Others are just getting to know him,” Caroline Kennedy, the U.S. ambassador to Australia, said of her cousin, President-elect Donald J. Trump’s pick for health secretary.

headline: Five-Star, Five-Ingredient Creamy Miso Pasta
abstract: “Rarely have I found a recipe that delivers so deliciously in proportion to its simplicity.”
lead_paragraph: “So how come you call it midnight pasta when you can’t stay awake past 10?” my daughter asked as I was cooking pasta with garlic, anchovies and red pepper flakes.
snippet: “Rarely have I found a recipe that delivers so deliciously in proportion to its simplicity.”

headline: Park Avenue Armory Will Host Yoko Ono’s ‘Wish Tree’ and Jamie xx
abstract: The Armory’s upcoming season also includes the world premiere of “DOOM,” a new work from the Golden Lion winner Anne Imhof.
lead_paragraph: The Park Avenue Armory announced its 2025 season on Monday, which includes the North American tour debut for the musician and producer Jamie xx’s new album “In Waves” and the largest ever North American installation of the artist Yoko Ono’s “Wish Tree,” a grove of almost 100 trees that will arrive at the Armory for visitors to attach wishes to.
snippet: The Armory’s upcoming season also includes the world premiere of “DOOM,” a new work from the Golden Lion winner Anne Imhof.

headline: How Will Trump’s Plans Affect the Economy? Here Are 4 Crucial Wild Cards.
abstract: Economists are trying to guess at how Trump policies could affect growth and inflation. The uncertainties are huge.
lead_paragraph: Predicting how White House policy is going to affect the American economy is always fraught with uncertainty. Donald J. Trump’s return to the White House has taken the doubt up a notch.
snippet: Economists are trying to guess at how Trump policies could affect growth and inflation. The uncertainties are huge.

headline: Elon Musk Asked People to Upload Their Health Data. X Users Obliged.
abstract: Privacy experts cringed when people started feeding their medical images to the A.I. tool Grok.
lead_paragraph: Over the past few weeks, users on X have been submitting X-rays, MRIs, CT scans and other medical images to Grok, the platform’s artificial intelligence chatbot, asking for diagnoses. The reason: Elon Musk, X’s owner, suggested it.
snippet: Privacy experts cringed when people started feeding their medical images to the A.I. tool Grok.

headline: Associated Press to Cut Staff by 8%
abstract: The reductions come just two weeks after Election Day, when The A.P. played a key role in calling races across the United States.
lead_paragraph: The Associated Press said Monday that it was cutting its staff by 8 percent as part of a plan to adapt to fast-changing conditions in the media industry.
snippet: The reductions come just two weeks after Election Day, when The A.P. played a key role in calling races across the United States.

headline: Beirut Residents Reel Under Fresh Round of Israeli Airstrikes
abstract: In the first strikes on Beirut for weeks, at least 10 people were killed and 45 more injured according to Lebanon’s health ministry.
lead_paragraph: In the first strikes on Beirut for weeks, at least 10 people were killed and 45 more injured according to Lebanon’s health ministry.
snippet: In the first strikes on Beirut for weeks, at least 10 people were killed and 45 more injured according to Lebanon’s health ministry.

headline: Freedom for Scores of Venezuelan Prisoners Detained After Disputed Election
abstract: Experts say the release of some political prisoners may be an attempt by Venezuela’s autocrat to send a signal to President-elect Trump.
lead_paragraph: From inside a sweltering Tocorón prison on Sunday, the detained peered out at their anguished relatives, throwing kisses from small windows and yelling “Soon!”
snippet: Experts say the release of some political prisoners may be an attempt by Venezuela’s autocrat to send a signal to President-elect Trump.

headline: Trump’s ‘Game of Chicken’ With Appointments
abstract: Readers discuss the president-elect’s staff selections. Also: A bill to fight obesity; teaching core skills; Social Security math; alcohol and fine art.
lead_paragraph: To the Editor:
snippet: Readers discuss the president-elect’s staff selections. Also: A bill to fight obesity; teaching core skills; Social Security math; alcohol and fine art.

headline: How Well Do You Know These Memorable Couples of Literature?
abstract: Fiction of full of love stories. Try this short quiz on the romantic pairings in five 20th-century novels.
lead_paragraph: Fiction of full of love stories. Try this short quiz on the romantic pairings in five 20th-century novels.
snippet: Fiction of full of love stories. Try this short quiz on the romantic pairings in five 20th-century novels.

headline: Chauffeured Cars and Broadway Tickets: Inside the National Realtors Group
abstract: The National Association of Realtors, a nonprofit trade organization, offers lavish perks and payouts to its executive staff and its leaders.
lead_paragraph: When he became the chief executive of the National Association of Realtors seven years ago, Bob Goldberg negotiated a package of gold-plated perks.
snippet: The National Association of Realtors, a nonprofit trade organization, offers lavish perks and payouts to its executive staff and its leaders.

headline: North Carolina State Supreme Court Results
abstract: Get live results and maps from the 2024 North Carolina state supreme court general election.
lead_paragraph: Get live results and maps from the 2024 North Carolina state supreme court general election.
snippet: Get live results and maps from the 2024 North Carolina state supreme court general election.

headline: Quincy Jones Receives Posthumous Oscar, and Daughter Gives His Speech
abstract: At the Governors Awards, Rashida Jones spoke on behalf of her father, who died earlier this month at the age of 91.
lead_paragraph: Before his death two weeks ago, the musician and producer Quincy Jones wrote a speech he intended to deliver at the Governors Awards, where he would receive an honorary Oscar at the ceremony created by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences.
snippet: At the Governors Awards, Rashida Jones spoke on behalf of her father, who died earlier this month at the age of 91.

headline: Sons Tell of a ‘Devastated’ Family at Rape Trial in France
abstract: The men appeared in court, addressing their father, who admits to having drugged their mother over years and inviting dozens of men to rape her while she was unconscious.
lead_paragraph: It was not just Gisèle Pelicot’s life that collapsed the day the police delivered the news that they believed that her husband of 50 years had been drugging her and inviting other men into their house to rape her alongside him for almost a decade.
snippet: The men appeared in court, addressing their father, who admits to having drugged their mother over years and inviting dozens of men to rape her while she was unconscious.

headline: Gold Watch, a Gift From Titanic Survivors, Sells for Nearly $2 Million
abstract: The gold watch was given to the captain of the Carpathia, the ship that responded to the Titanic’s distress call and rescued hundreds of people.
lead_paragraph: It’s a fine gold Tiffany pocket watch. It probably sold for $20 or $30 when it was first purchased in 1912, and Andrew Aldridge, the managing director of the British auction house Henry Aldridge & Son, guessed that such a watch might normally bring about $10,000 at auction today.
snippet: The gold watch was given to the captain of the Carpathia, the ship that responded to the Titanic’s distress call and rescued hundreds of people.

headline: Did School Battles Hurt Democrats in Liberal Strongholds?
abstract: Voters in the Virginia suburbs shifted toward Trump. Some said they were still frustrated by pandemic closures and fights over gender, race and testing in schools.
lead_paragraph: As the election results rolled in on the evening of Nov. 5, the state of Virginia offered an early, alarming portent for Democrats.
snippet: Voters in the Virginia suburbs shifted toward Trump. Some said they were still frustrated by pandemic closures and fights over gender, race and testing in schools.

headline: How Did Fans Dress for Tyler, the Creator’s L.A. Carnival?
abstract: Crowds filled Dodger Stadium for Camp Flog Gnaw, showing off their street style best.
lead_paragraph: Over the weekend, Dodger Stadium transformed into a carnival of sorts.
snippet: Crowds filled Dodger Stadium for Camp Flog Gnaw, showing off their street style best.

headline: Martin O’Malley, Ex-Maryland Governor, Kicks Off Race to Lead D.N.C.
abstract: Mr. O’Malley, who ran for president in 2016, is the first candidate to announce a bid to lead the reeling Democratic Party as it faces two years of powerlessness in Washington.
lead_paragraph: Martin O’Malley, the former Maryland governor and Baltimore mayor who for the last year has served as commissioner of the Social Security Administration, on Monday became the first announced candidate for chair of the Democratic National Committee.
snippet: Mr. O’Malley, who ran for president in 2016, is the first candidate to announce a bid to lead the reeling Democratic Party as it faces two years of powerlessness in Washington.

headline: Yo-Yo Ma and Kathryn Stott Wrap Up a Partnership With Thanks
abstract: After 40 years of musical collaborations, this cellist and pianist have recorded their final album together, “Merci.”
lead_paragraph: Of all the cellist Yo-Yo Ma’s many, many collaborations, the one with the pianist Kathryn Stott has been among his most enduring.
snippet: After 40 years of musical collaborations, this cellist and pianist have recorded their final album together, “Merci.”

headline: Opponents Renew Attacks as Congestion Pricing Plan Is Approved
abstract: Gov. Kathy Hochul is letting the tolling program move forward in January. Her critics have jumped on the chance to object to the reversal.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Kathy Hochul of New York resurrected congestion pricing last week, delighting transportation and environmental advocates eager for the benefits the plan promises, from less traffic and fresher air to improvements to mass transit.
snippet: Gov. Kathy Hochul is letting the tolling program move forward in January. Her critics have jumped on the chance to object to the reversal.

headline: ‘Morning Joe’ Stars Reveal a Mar-a-Lago Reunion With Trump
abstract: The MSNBC hosts Mika Brzezinski and Joe Scarborough met with Donald Trump last week in Florida in an effort “to restart communications.”
lead_paragraph: The married MSNBC hosts Mika Brzezinski and Joe Scarborough drove half an hour from their Florida home on Friday to meet with an old friend turned frenemy turned enemy: President-elect Donald J. Trump.
snippet: The MSNBC hosts Mika Brzezinski and Joe Scarborough met with Donald Trump last week in Florida in an effort “to restart communications.”

headline: What Travelers Should Know About the Spirit Airlines Bankruptcy
abstract: Flights will still take off and travelers can keep booking tickets, the low-cost carrier said, as the company enters Chapter 11 bankruptcy.
lead_paragraph: Spirit Airlines filed for bankruptcy protection on Monday after struggling with a series of losses, but travelers should not panic.
snippet: Flights will still take off and travelers can keep booking tickets, the low-cost carrier said, as the company enters Chapter 11 bankruptcy.

headline: Trump Confirms Plans to Use the Military to Assist in Mass Deportations
abstract: Mr. Trump’s top immigration policy adviser has discussed using military assets to build detention centers and support civilian immigration agents.
lead_paragraph: President-elect Donald J. Trump confirmed on Monday that he intended to declare a national emergency and use the U.S. military in some form to assist in his plans for mass deportations of undocumented immigrants.
snippet: Mr. Trump’s top immigration policy adviser has discussed using military assets to build detention centers and support civilian immigration agents.

headline: Picking Up My Rifle Once More as I Cover Guns in America
abstract: A reporter and former infantryman in Afghanistan had let his AR-15, used for target shooting, collect dust. Then he began writing about gun culture.
lead_paragraph: When I was 9, my dad took me down to my grandfather’s basement. In one corner, the elder Gibbons-Neff had his desk, along with a painting of the submarine-hunting warship he had crewed in World War II and a locked cabinet full of guns.
snippet: A reporter and former infantryman in Afghanistan had let his AR-15, used for target shooting, collect dust. Then he began writing about gun culture.

headline: Man Is Charged With Killing 3 in Random Stabbings Across Manhattan
abstract: Ramon Rivera, 51, attacked the victims in an unprovoked spree that began in Manhattan’s Chelsea neighborhood and ended near the United Nations, the police said.
lead_paragraph: It was just before 8:30 a.m. Monday, the police said, when a man approached a construction worker on West 19th Street in Manhattan and, without warning, stabbed him in the gut and ran off. The victim was soon declared dead.
snippet: Ramon Rivera, 51, attacked the victims in an unprovoked spree that began in Manhattan’s Chelsea neighborhood and ended near the United Nations, the police said.

headline: Bannon’s New York Trial on Fraud Charges Is Postponed Until February
abstract: The key adviser to Donald J. Trump is accused of cheating people who donated to build a border wall. Mr. Trump pardoned him when he faced similar federal charges in his first term.
lead_paragraph: Stephen K. Bannon’s trial on charges that he schemed to defraud people who donated money to build the southern border wall championed by Donald J. Trump was delayed on Monday by a judge in Manhattan.
snippet: The key adviser to Donald J. Trump is accused of cheating people who donated to build a border wall. Mr. Trump pardoned him when he faced similar federal charges in his first term.

headline: How Elon Musk’s and Vivek Ramaswamy’s Government-Slashing Spree Could Backfire
abstract: If they’re not careful, they could make the government’s efficiency problems worse.
lead_paragraph: Elon Musk and Vivek Ramaswamy are the perfect partners for a president-elect whose signature phrase before his time in the White House was, “You’re fired.” About 80 percent of Twitter’s employees were laid off or quit after Musk bought the social media platform and renamed it X. Ramaswamy said on a September podcast that if the federal government fired 75 percent of its employees, “not a thing” would change “for the ordinary American, other than the size of their government being a lot smaller and more restrained, spending a lot less money to operate it.”
snippet: If they’re not careful, they could make the government’s efficiency problems worse.

headline: SpaceX Starship’s Sonic Boom Creates Risk of Structural Damage, Test Finds
abstract: An independent researcher found that noise recorded miles away from the site of a recent test flight was equal to standing 200 feet from a Boeing 747 during takeoff.
lead_paragraph: SpaceX’s new Starship rocket far exceeds projected maximum noise levels, generating a sonic boom so powerful it risks property damage in the densely populated residential community near its South Texas launch site, new data suggests.
snippet: An independent researcher found that noise recorded miles away from the site of a recent test flight was equal to standing 200 feet from a Boeing 747 during takeoff.

headline: Glitz, Glamour and Trash-Talk at the ‘Ultimate Fantasy Competition’
abstract: A fantasy football championship featured YouTubers, comedians and athletes, with ESPN’s Stephen A. Smith as its guest of honor.
lead_paragraph: It was late Sunday evening at Pullman Yards, a former fertilizer plant and industrial complex that now serves as an entertainment venue on the east side of Atlanta, and the YouTuber Kyle Forgeard’s path to victory in a glammed-up fantasy football championship was narrowing.
snippet: A fantasy football championship featured YouTubers, comedians and athletes, with ESPN’s Stephen A. Smith as its guest of honor.

headline: Veteran Who Was Court Martialed Gets 4 Years in Prison for Jan. 6 Attack
abstract: Edward Richmond Jr., 41, of Geismar, La., a former U.S. Army soldier who had served time in the killing of an Iraqi citizen, was sentenced to 51 months for assaulting police officers during the 2021 Capitol riot.
lead_paragraph: A former U.S. Army soldier who was found guilty of voluntary manslaughter in the killing of an Iraqi civilian in 2004 was sentenced on Monday to more than four years in prison for assaulting police officers during the Jan. 6, 2021, riot at the U.S. Capitol.
snippet: Edward Richmond Jr., 41, of Geismar, La., a former U.S. Army soldier who had served time in the killing of an Iraqi citizen, was sentenced to 51 months for assaulting police officers during the 2021 Capitol riot.

headline: How Tulsi Gabbard Became a Favorite of Russia’s State Media
abstract: President-elect Donald J. Trump’s pick to be the director of national intelligence has raised alarms among national security officials.
lead_paragraph: In 2017, when she was still a Democratic member of Congress, Tulsi Gabbard traveled to Syria and met the country’s authoritarian president, Bashar al-Assad. She also accused the United States of supporting terrorists there.
snippet: President-elect Donald J. Trump’s pick to be the director of national intelligence has raised alarms among national security officials.

headline: Tuesday Briefing: Ukraine is Poised to Strike inside Russia
abstract: Plus, revelations from a kids’ soccer coach.
lead_paragraph: President Volodymyr Zelensky suggested that Kyiv’s first launches of long-range weapons inside Russian territory would come soon and without warning. The move signals a new sense of urgency after President Biden’s decision to allow long-range strikes inside Russia using American-provided missiles.
snippet: Plus, revelations from a kids’ soccer coach.

headline: Mining Company Whose C.E.O. Was Detained Agrees to Pay Mali $160 Million
abstract: Three executives of the Australian company Resolute Mining were arrested this month. Mali, a major African gold producer, has been trying to increase its share of mining profits lately.
lead_paragraph: An Australian mining company said it would pay the military government of Mali $160 million after the authorities detained three of its executives for over a week in a dispute about taxes.
snippet: Three executives of the Australian company Resolute Mining were arrested this month. Mali, a major African gold producer, has been trying to increase its share of mining profits lately.

headline: ‘Leonardo da Vinci’ Is a Humanizing Look Into a Great Mind
abstract: Beyond the appropriate awe, this two-part PBS documentary, co-directed by Ken Burns, adds human texture to the hagiography.
lead_paragraph: “Leonardo da Vinci,” a four-hour, two-part documentary airing on PBS on Monday and Tuesday at 8 p.m. (check local listings), is a thorough and engrossing biography that can’t help but feel incomplete, so vast and unusual is its subject. “Leonardo, for his time, possesses the most knowledge in the world,” one expert explains.
snippet: Beyond the appropriate awe, this two-part PBS documentary, co-directed by Ken Burns, adds human texture to the hagiography.

headline: Pancreatic Cancer Surge May Be Less Worrisome Than It Seemed
abstract: A rise in the disease in younger people was not followed by an increase in deaths, a study found, and might be a sign of overdiagnosis.
lead_paragraph: One of the first warnings came in a paper published in 2021. There was an unexpected rise in pancreatic cancer among young people in the United States from 2000 to 2018. The illness can be untreatable by the time it is discovered, a death sentence.
snippet: A rise in the disease in younger people was not followed by an increase in deaths, a study found, and might be a sign of overdiagnosis.

headline: Biden’s Parting Gift to Ukraine Could Also Help Trump
abstract: Trump can stop the missiles to be used against Russia, but he may not want to.
lead_paragraph: Acceding to Ukraine’s longstanding pleas for permission to fire American missiles into Russian territory may be the last thing President Biden can do for the Ukrainians — or on any other foreign front, for that matter — before leaving office. That makes for dodgy optics, because it saddles an incoming administration with a policy shift Biden himself long resisted because he thought it carried too great a risk of plunging America into a direct confrontation with Russia.
snippet: Trump can stop the missiles to be used against Russia, but he may not want to.

headline: Trump’s Signature Dance Move Finds Its Way to the Sports World
abstract: Jon Jones punctuated his U.F.C. win with the president-elect’s shimmy. Numerous N.F.L. players, and a U.S. soccer star have followed suit.
lead_paragraph: The first thing to know about the Donald J. Trump dance craze is that it’s not really a craze. (Not yet, at least.) Nor, to be honest, is it a dance.
snippet: Jon Jones punctuated his U.F.C. win with the president-elect’s shimmy. Numerous N.F.L. players, and a U.S. soccer star have followed suit.

headline: Pennsylvania’s Top Court Tells Counties to Stop Defying Its Ballot Order
abstract: The decision came after officials in at least four counties had ignored the court’s pre-election guidance not to count mail ballots that were undated or misdated.
lead_paragraph: The Pennsylvania Supreme Court on Monday directed county election officials to stop defying the court’s guidance not to count mail ballots that were missing dates or had errors in the date field on the outer return envelope.
snippet: The decision came after officials in at least four counties had ignored the court’s pre-election guidance not to count mail ballots that were undated or misdated.

headline: Trump Plans to Attend Musk’s SpaceX Launch on Tuesday
abstract: The president-elect’s decision to witness the liftoff is another example of his close ties to the world’s wealthiest entrepreneur.
lead_paragraph: President-elect Donald J. Trump plans to attend a SpaceX launch in Texas on Tuesday, according to two people familiar with the planning, in yet another demonstration of the billionaire Elon Musk’s increasing closeness to the incoming president.
snippet: The president-elect’s decision to witness the liftoff is another example of his close ties to the world’s wealthiest entrepreneur.

headline: Trump Said He Plans to Use ‘Military Assets’ for Deportations
abstract: Also, Ukraine is poised to strike Russia with U.S. weapons. Here’s the latest at the end of Monday.
lead_paragraph: President-elect Donald Trump confirmed today that he intended to declare a national emergency and use the U.S. military to assist in his plans to deport millions of undocumented immigrants. He responded “TRUE!!!” to a post by a conservative activist summarizing the strategy.
snippet: Also, Ukraine is poised to strike Russia with U.S. weapons. Here’s the latest at the end of Monday.

headline: Morgan Jenness, 72, Dies; Her Artistic Vision Influenced American Theater
abstract: A beloved figure in the theatrical community, she redefined the role of dramaturg, influencing playwrights like David Adjmi and David Henry Hwang.
lead_paragraph: Morgan Jenness, a dramaturg, teacher and theatrical agent who nurtured the work of countless playwrights — including Taylor Mac, David Adjmi, David Henry Hwang, Larry Kramer and Maria Irene Fornés — died on Nov. 12 in Manhattan. Ms. Jenness, who in recent years began using the pronouns they/them and she interchangeably, was 72.
snippet: A beloved figure in the theatrical community, she redefined the role of dramaturg, influencing playwrights like David Adjmi and David Henry Hwang.

headline: Sandra M. Gilbert, Co-Author of ‘The Madwoman in the Attic,’ Dies at 87
abstract: A poet, scholar and literary critic, she turned a feminist lens on 19th-century writers like Jane Austen and Charlotte Brontë, creating a feminist classic.
lead_paragraph: Sandra M. Gilbert, a critic, scholar, poet and co-author of “The Madwoman in the Attic: The Woman Writer and the Nineteenth-Century Literary Imagination,” a groundbreaking work of literary criticism that became a feminist classic, died on Nov. 10 in Berkeley, Calif. She was 87.
snippet: A poet, scholar and literary critic, she turned a feminist lens on 19th-century writers like Jane Austen and Charlotte Brontë, creating a feminist classic.

headline: The Governor Who Helped Trump Get Elected
abstract: Greg Abbott in Texas, sending busloads of migrants to blue cities, helped put the border crisis more fully into view for the nation.
lead_paragraph: It all seemed like a gimmick at first. A chartered bus from Del Rio, Texas, with 24 migrants on board arrived at Union Station in Washington on April 13, 2022. More buses would soon be headed there and elsewhere.
snippet: Greg Abbott in Texas, sending busloads of migrants to blue cities, helped put the border crisis more fully into view for the nation.

headline: Biden Asks Congress for Nearly $100 Billion in Disaster Aid
abstract: The president said the aid was “urgently needed” as emergency programs face funding shortfalls amid the devastation after Hurricanes Helene and Milton and a string of other natural disasters.
lead_paragraph: President Biden urged Congress on Monday to provide nearly $100 billion in “urgently needed” aid for communities ravaged by hurricanes and other disasters in recent months, saying funding for some critical programs has either run out or is nearly exhausted.
snippet: The president said the aid was “urgently needed” as emergency programs face funding shortfalls amid the devastation after Hurricanes Helene and Milton and a string of other natural disasters.

headline: Gaetz May Not Be Confirmed, Trump Admits. He’s Pushing Him and Others Anyway.
abstract: The president-elect is taking a flood-the-zone approach to his cabinet nominations, betting that the Senate won’t dare to turn them all down.
lead_paragraph: In his private conversations over the past few days, President-elect Donald J. Trump has admitted that his besieged choice for attorney general, Matt Gaetz, has less than even odds of being confirmed by the Senate.
snippet: The president-elect is taking a flood-the-zone approach to his cabinet nominations, betting that the Senate won’t dare to turn them all down.

headline: New York City Drought Warning Declared for First Time in Over 20 Years
abstract: The warning, which extends beyond the city to include 10 other counties in New York State, was announced as wildfires burned and residents continued to await meaningful rainfall.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Eric Adams on Monday elevated New York City’s drought watch to a drought warning, the last step before declaring a drought emergency, which would come with mandatory water restrictions.
snippet: The warning, which extends beyond the city to include 10 other counties in New York State, was announced as wildfires burned and residents continued to await meaningful rainfall.
